thread.title: Athletes and teams around Chicago went crazy when the Cubs clinched the NLDS
thread.title_full: Athletes and teams around Chicago went crazy when the Cubs clinched the NLDS | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Athletes and teams around Chicago went crazy when the Cubs clinched the NLDS
text:
When a team in Chicago is on a roll, everyone gets on board. Not only did Cubs fans celebrate Tuesday night when the Cubs clinched their NLDS series against the Cardinals, but athletes across the city enjoyed the game.
From the moment Hector Rondon got the final strike of the game through the hours of celebration that would follow, Twitter was filled with congratulatory messages.
But the Cubs had some celebrating to do of their own.
Dexter Fowler and his wife Darya Congratulations Cubs!! pic.twitter.com/ZzM8JQJ9qG
— Darya Aliya Fowler (@DaryaAliya) October 14, 2015
Anthony Rizzo and his mom Mama we made it #WEAREGOOD #NLDS #LETSGO @Cubs pic.twitter.com/qeTUOizaGB
— Anthony Rizzo (@ARizzo44) October 14, 2015
Miguel Montero is still right #WeAreGood #WeAreGood
— miguel montero (@miggymont26) October 14, 2015
Jorge Soler is making a lot of Cubs fans feel old In 2003 I was 11. Dreams do come true. #SolerPower #FlyTheW‌ pic.twitter.com/kxraehdPVg
— Jorge Soler (@JorgeSoler68) October 14, 2015
Dan Haren asks the important questions @realDonaldTrump are you happy the Cubs won
— dan haren (@ithrow88) October 14, 2015
Other teams and athletes from other sports around Chicago took part in the celebration as well, as they have since the start of the postseason.
The Blackhawks love the Cubs CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! CUBS! #FLYTHEW
— Chicago Blackhawks (@NHLBlackhawks) October 13, 2015
Congrats to the @Cubs on to the next! Making Chicago proud!
— Andrew Shaw (@shawz15er) October 14, 2015
Cubs win! #WeAreGood
— Scott Darling (@SDarling_33) October 13, 2015
The Bears are proud of the Cubs Ho.
Lee.
Cow!
Great win, @Cubs .
NLCS up next! #FlyTheW pic.twitter.com/nRpf9f3BqZ
— Chicago Bears (@ChicagoBears) October 13, 2015
It's always an amazing feeling to see the @Cubs win the NLDS, it truly is! But it's even more special when it comes against them‼️ #FlyTheW
— Lance Briggs (@LanceBriggs) October 13, 2015
Congrats cubs you boys deserve it #flythew https://t.co/BH4ZIyVLDL
— Robbie Gould (@RobbieGould09) October 14, 2015
The Sky has been on board Leaving work for the @Cubs game today like… #FlyTheW‌ #FinishEm #cubs pic.twitter.com/IC7lAx5Hvh
— CHICAGO SKY (@wnbachicagosky) October 13, 2015
Bulls keep it short and sweet #FlyTheW @Cubs ! #OneCity
— Chicago Bulls (@chicagobulls) October 13, 2015
Even the Fire hate St. Louis Sorry we're not sorry @SaintLouisFC .
 #LETSG #FlyTheW @Cubs pic.twitter.com/ikF6VrU8et
— Chicago Fire (@ChicagoFire) October 13, 2015
